text: i feel like all of this rework should be put into something like blockstore or some other effort that’s already working on this.
is this going to be all browser based?
your db structure is just a key-value store? so just one big data table? that would suffice for the DHT data but will you need anything else specific to the client? like settings/preferences?

<@U08DDG1SB>: client settings for people/collectives that they follow and their own filtering/sorting preferences can probably be stored in indexedDB in the same manner. Just have separate stores for Addresses/Identities; Content/Messages; Settings/Preferences
<@U08DDG1SB>: haven't actually put much thought into the db schema. don't take minimalist data structure too seriously.
